Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393346) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393346)
